title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement bonhomme.vincent@gmail.com. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Vincent Bonhomme. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bonhomme V (2026). Momit: Import Export MomX Foreign mMrphometric Data. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/MomX/Momit.
code: @Manual{,   title = {Momit: Import and Export MomX and Foreign mMrphometric Data},   author = {Vincent Bonhomme},   year = {2026},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/MomX/Momit}, }

what: Momit • Import/export MomX and foreign morphometric data
title: Momit • Import/export MomX and foreign morphometric data
text: goal Momit …

title: Momit • Import/export MomX and foreign morphometric data
text: can install development version Momit GitHub :
code: # install.packages("pak") pak::pak("MomX/Momit")

title: Momit • Import/export MomX and foreign morphometric data
text: basic example shows solve common problem: special using README.Rmd instead just README.md? can include R chunks like : ’ll still need render README.Rmd regularly, keep README.md --date. devtools::build_readme() handy . can also embed plots, example:  case, don’t forget commit push resulting figure files, display GitHub CRAN.
code: library(Momit) ## basic example code summary(cars) #>      speed           dist        #>  Min.   : 4.0   Min.   :  2.00   #>  1st Qu.:12.0   1st Qu.: 26.00   #>  Median :15.0   Median : 36.00   #>  Mean   :15.4   Mean   : 42.98   #>  3rd Qu.:19.0   3rd Qu.: 56.00   #>  Max.   :25.0   Max.   :120.00

what: Import Momocs objects to tibble format — from_Momocs
title: Import Momocs objects to tibble format — from_Momocs
text: Converts legacy Momocs objects (, Opn, Ldk classes) tidy tibble format compatible Momocs2. Combines $coo list $fac data frame single tibble list columns.

title: Import Momocs objects to tibble format — from_Momocs
code: from_Momocs(x)

title: Import Momocs objects to tibble format — from_Momocs
text: x Momocs object (, Opn, Ldk)

title: Import Momocs objects to tibble format — from_Momocs
text: tibble : List column "coo" classes: c("", "coo") objects (closed outlines) c("cur", "coo") Opn objects (open curves) c("ldk", "coo") Ldk objects (landmarks) Individual matrices coo class "xy" Additional list column "ldk_id" landmarks present columns $fac (can empty)

title: Import Momocs objects to tibble format — from_Momocs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Load Momocs object momit_load("Momocs/bot.rda")  # Convert to tibble bot_tbl <- from_Momocs(bot)  # Check structure class(bot_tbl$coo)     # "out" "coo" "list" class(bot_tbl$coo[[1]]) # "xy" "matrix" "array" } # }

what: Import JSON to tibble with smart matrix reconstruction — from_json
title: Import JSON to tibble with smart matrix reconstruction — from_json
text: Reads JSON reconstructs matrix columns coordinate arrays. Automatically detects applies column metadata present.

title: Import JSON to tibble with smart matrix reconstruction — from_json
code: from_json(path = NULL, text = NULL, ...)

title: Import JSON to tibble with smart matrix reconstruction — from_json
text: path Path JSON file (optional text provided) text JSON string (optional path provided) ... Additional arguments passed jsonlite::fromJSON

title: Import JSON to tibble with smart matrix reconstruction — from_json
text: tibble matrix columns reconstructed classes applied

title: Import JSON to tibble with smart matrix reconstruction — from_json
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # From file bot2 <- from_json("bot.json")  # From string json_str <- to_json(bot) bot3 <- from_json(text = json_str) } # }

what: Extract outline from mask image (convenience wrapper) — from_mask
title: Extract outline from mask image (convenience wrapper) — from_mask
text: Loads image, converts binary mask using flood fill, extracts outline. Combines img_load(), img_mask() trace_outline().

title: Extract outline from mask image (convenience wrapper) — from_mask
code: from_mask(path, fuzz = 20)

title: Extract outline from mask image (convenience wrapper) — from_mask
text: path Character. Path image file fuzz Integer. Fuzz/tolerance flood fill (0-255). Default 20

title: Extract outline from mask image (convenience wrapper) — from_mask
text: Matrix (n × 2) x,y coordinates. Class c("", "coo", "matrix", "array")

title: Extract outline from mask image (convenience wrapper) — from_mask
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Simple use outline <- from_mask("leaf.png")  # Adjust fuzz for noisy backgrounds outline <- from_mask("leaf.png", fuzz = 30) } # }

what: Extract multiple outlines from mask image — from_mask_multi
title: Extract multiple outlines from mask image — from_mask_multi
text: Extracts outlines mask containing multiple objects using base R's contourLines(). connected object gets outline. external dependencies required.

title: Extract multiple outlines from mask image — from_mask_multi
code: from_mask_multi(path, fuzz = 20, min_size = 10)

title: Extract multiple outlines from mask image — from_mask_multi
text: path Character. Path image file, mask matrix fuzz Integer. Fuzz/tolerance flood fill (0-255). Default 20 used path character min_size Integer. Minimum number points outline. Default 10 Filters tiny spurious contours

title: Extract multiple outlines from mask image — from_mask_multi
text: List outline matrices, (n × 2) class c("", "coo", "matrix", "array")

title: Extract multiple outlines from mask image — from_mask_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Extract all objects outlines <- from_mask_multi("petri_dish.png") length(outlines)  # Number of objects found  # Plot them plot(outlines[[1]], type = "l", asp = 1) for (i in 2:length(outlines)) {   lines(outlines[[i]], col = i) } } # }

what: Load image as grayscale matrix — img_load
title: Load image as grayscale matrix — img_load
text: Reads image format returns grayscale matrix integers (0-255). Useful custom image processing outline extraction.

title: Load image as grayscale matrix — img_load
code: img_load(path, color = FALSE, flip = FALSE)

title: Load image as grayscale matrix — img_load
text: path Character. Path image file color Logical. Keep RGB color? Default FALSE (convert grayscale) flip Logical. Flip vertically? (Images top-, coords bottom-). Default TRUE

title: Load image as grayscale matrix — img_load
text: color=FALSE: Integer matrix (nrow = height, ncol = width) values 0-255 color=TRUE: Integer array (nrow = height, ncol = width, 3) RGB values 0-255

title: Load image as grayscale matrix — img_load
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Load as grayscale img <- img_load("leaf.jpg") dim(img)  # height x width  # Load as color img_rgb <- img_load("leaf.jpg", color = TRUE) dim(img_rgb)  # height x width x 3  # For most uses, just call from_mask() directly outline <- from_mask("leaf.jpg") } # }

what: Convert image to binary mask using flood fill — img_mask
title: Convert image to binary mask using flood fill — img_mask
text: Creates binary mask flood-filling background top-left corner, setting non-background pixels black (TRUE). handles complex backgrounds multiple objects uniformly.

title: Convert image to binary mask using flood fill — img_mask
code: img_mask(img, fuzz = 20, invert = TRUE)

title: Convert image to binary mask using flood fill — img_mask
text: img Integer matrix (0-255) img_load() fuzz Integer. Fuzz/tolerance flood fill (0-255). Default 20 Controls similar pixels must considered background. Low (5-10): strict, similar pixels Medium (20-30): Reasonable cases High (50+): Aggressive, may include object edges invert Logical. Invert mask? Default TRUE TRUE: object = FALSE (white), background = TRUE (black) FALSE: object = TRUE (black), background = FALSE (white)

title: Convert image to binary mask using flood fill — img_mask
text: Logical matrix (TRUE/FALSE depending invert setting)

title: Convert image to binary mask using flood fill — img_mask
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Standard (inverted): white object on black background img <- img_load("leaf.png") mask <- img_mask(img)  # Non-inverted: black object on white background mask_std <- img_mask(img, invert = FALSE)  # Adjust fuzz for noisy backgrounds mask <- img_mask(img, fuzz = 30) } # }

title: Add padding (border) to image — img_pad
text: Adds border pixels around image. Useful ensuring objects touch image edges flood fill.

title: Add padding (border) to image — img_pad
code: img_pad(img, n = 10, value = NULL)

title: Add padding (border) to image — img_pad
text: img Matrix array. Image img_load() binary mask n Integer. Number pixels add side. Default 10 value Numeric logical. Value padding pixels. grayscale (0-255): Default 255 (white) masks: Default FALSE (background) color: Specify c(R, G, B) single value (default 255)

title: Add padding (border) to image — img_pad
text: Padded image dimensions increased 2*n direction

title: Add padding (border) to image — img_pad
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ img <- img_load("leaf.png") img_padded <- img_pad(img, n = 20) dim(img)        # e.g., 100 x 100 dim(img_padded) # 140 x 140  # Pad a mask mask <- img_mask(img) mask_padded <- img_pad(mask, n = 10, value = FALSE) } # }

title: Plot image matrix — img_plot
text: Plots grayscale color images proper axes. Uses base graphics useRaster=TRUE speed. Images displayed natural orientation (appear image viewers).

title: Plot image matrix — img_plot
code: img_plot(img, col = gray.colors(256, start = 0, end = 1), main = NULL)

title: Plot image matrix — img_plot
text: img Matrix array. Either: Integer matrix (0-255) grayscale img_load() Logical matrix binary masks Array (nrow, ncol, 3) RGB color images col Color palette grayscale. Default gray scale. Use c("white", "black") masks main Character. Plot title. Default NULL

title: Plot image matrix — img_plot
text: Invisibly returns image

title: Plot image matrix — img_plot
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Plot grayscale image img <- img_load("leaf.png") img_plot(img)  # Plot binary mask mask <- img_mask(img) img_plot(mask, col = c("white", "black"), main = "Binary mask") } # }

title: Remove padding (border) from image — img_unpad
text: Removes border pixels around image. Inverse img_pad().

title: Remove padding (border) from image — img_unpad
code: img_unpad(img, n = 10)

title: Remove padding (border) from image — img_unpad
text: img Matrix array. Padded image n Integer. Number pixels remove side. Default 10

title: Remove padding (border) from image — img_unpad
text: Unpadded image dimensions decreased 2*n direction

title: Remove padding (border) from image — img_unpad
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ img <- img_load("leaf.png") img_padded <- img_pad(img, n = 20) img_back <- img_unpad(img_padded, n = 20) identical(img, img_back)  # TRUE } # }

what: Example data files in inst/extdata — momit_data
title: Example data files in inst/extdata — momit_data
text: Momit package includes example data files testing demonstrations. Access momit_example().

title: Example data files in inst/extdata — momit_data
text: malus/ Apple leaf images (2 JPG files) vitis/ Grapevine leaf images organized specimen: - 0641_cPinNoN_B/ - Pinot Noir specimen (6 JPG files, dorsal/ventral views) - 0786_cCabSaN_B/ - Cabernet Sauvignon specimen (6 JPG files, dorsal/ventral views) - meta.csv - Metadata vitis specimens Momocs/ Legacy Momocs datasets (.rda files): - bot.rda - Bottle outlines dataset - chaff.rda - Cereal chaff outlines - hearts.rda - Heart shapes dataset - olea.rda - Olive stones dataset tps/ TPS landmark files (various sources): - AE/ - Two data files - JC/ - Single dataset tpsdig/ TPS files tpsdig software (2 files) nts/ NTS format files: - RohlfArchieWingOutlines.nts - Wing outlines - RohlfSlice1990Mosq.nts - Mosquito data txt/ Plain text coordinate files (2 face datasets)

title: Example data files in inst/extdata — momit_data
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # List all available files momit_example()  # Get path to specific file momit_example("malus/malus_1.jpg")  # Load and use an image img <- img_load(momit_example("malus/malus_1.jpg")) img_plot(img)  # Load Momocs dataset momit_example("Momocs/bot.rda") %>% load(envir = .GlobalEnv) } # }

what: Get path to example files — momit_example
title: Get path to example files — momit_example
text: Get path example files

title: Get path to example files — momit_example
code: momit_example(file = NULL)

title: Get path to example files — momit_example
text: file Character. File name path within extdata

title: Get path to example files — momit_example
code: momit_example() # all examples #>  [1] "Momocs/bot.rda"                                          #>  [2] "Momocs/chaff.rda"                                        #>  [3] "Momocs/hearts.rda"                                       #>  [4] "Momocs/olea.rda"                                         #>  [5] "malus/malus_1.jpg"                                       #>  [6] "malus/malus_2.jpg"                                       #>  [7] "nts/RohlfArchieWingOutlines.nts"                         #>  [8] "nts/RohlfSlice1990Mosq.nts"                              #>  [9] "tps/AE/data1.tps"                                        #> [10] "tps/AE/data2.tps"                                        #> [11] "tps/JC/data.TPS"                                         #> [12] "tpsdig/allo1.tps"                                        #> [13] "tpsdig/allo2.tps"                                        #> [14] "txt/face1.txt"                                           #> [15] "txt/face2.txt"                                           #> [16] "vitis/jpg/0641_cPinNoN_B/0641_cPinNoN_B-B02_P01_VD.jpg"  #> [17] "vitis/jpg/0641_cPinNoN_B/0641_cPinNoN_B_B01_P01_VD.jpg"  #> [18] "vitis/jpg/0641_cPinNoN_B/0641_cPinNoN_B_B01_P01_VL.jpg"  #> [19] "vitis/jpg/0641_cPinNoN_B/0641_cPinNoN_B_B02_P01_VL.jpg"  #> [20] "vitis/jpg/0641_cPinNoN_B/0641_cPinNoN_B_B03_P02_VL.jpg"  #> [21] "vitis/jpg/0641_cPinNoN_B/0641b_cPinNoN_B_B03_P02_VD.jpg" #> [22] "vitis/jpg/0786_cCabSaN_B/0786-cCabSaN_B_B02_P01_VL.jpg"  #> [23] "vitis/jpg/0786_cCabSaN_B/0786_cCabSaN_B_B01_P01_VD.jpg"  #> [24] "vitis/jpg/0786_cCabSaN_B/0786_cCabSaN_B_B01_P01_VL.jpg"  #> [25] "vitis/jpg/0786_cCabSaN_B/0786_cCabSaN_B_B02_P01_VD.jpg"  #> [26] "vitis/jpg/0786_cCabSaN_B/0786_cCabSaN_B_B03_P01_VD.jpg"  #> [27] "vitis/jpg/0786_cCabSaN_B/0786_cCabSaN_B_B03_P01_VL.jpg"  #> [28] "vitis/meta.csv"                                          # a text like file would return path and be good for from_tps etc. momit_example("tps/AE/data1.tps") #> [1] "/home/runner/work/_temp/Library/Momit/extdata/tps/AE/data1.tps"  # note that .rda example must be either embraced with load() # or be piped with %>% load(envir = .GlobalEnv) # this will work: load(momit_example("Momocs/bot.rda")) # this will also work: momit_example("Momocs/bot.rda") %>% load(envir = .GlobalEnv) # but this will NOT work: momit_example("Momocs/bot.rda") %>% load()

what: Calculate object size in memory and on disk — obj_size
title: Calculate object size in memory and on disk — obj_size
text: Returns size R objects memory estimated/actual size disk. objects: estimates .rda size default, .json object JSON string. files: returns actual file size.

title: Calculate object size in memory and on disk — obj_size
code: obj_size(x, units = "auto", compression = "gzip")

title: Calculate object size in memory and on disk — obj_size
text: x R object, JSON string, path file units Character, one "auto", "B", "KB", "MB", "GB". Default "auto" compression Compression .rda files. Default "gzip"

title: Calculate object size in memory and on disk — obj_size
text: list class "obj_size" containing memory, disk, ratio, format

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: See magrittr::%>% details.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
code: lhs %>% rhs

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: lhs value magrittr placeholder. rhs function call using magrittr semantics.

title: Pipe operator — %>%
text: result calling rhs(lhs).

what: Export tibble to Momocs format — to_Momocs
title: Export tibble to Momocs format — to_Momocs
text: Converts Momocs2 tibble back legacy Momocs format (, Opn, Ldk). regressive function may useful compatibility legacy Momocs code tools.

title: Export tibble to Momocs format — to_Momocs
code: to_Momocs(x, type = NULL)

title: Export tibble to Momocs format — to_Momocs
text: x tibble "coo" list column type Character. Type Momocs object create: "", "Opn", "Ldk". NULL (default), inferred class coo column.

title: Export tibble to Momocs format — to_Momocs
text: Momocs object (, Opn, Ldk) : $coo: list coordinate matrices (without classes) $fac: tibble non-coo, non-ldk_id columns $ldk: list landmark positions (ldk_id column present)

title: Export tibble to Momocs format — to_Momocs
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Convert from Momocs bot_tbl <- from_Momocs(bot)  # Do some processing...  # Convert back to Momocs bot_back <- to_Momocs(bot_tbl)  # Check class class(bot_back)  # "Out" "Coo" } # }

what: Export tibble to JSON with smart matrix handling — to_json
title: Export tibble to JSON with smart matrix handling — to_json
text: Converts tibbles JSON, intelligently handling matrix columns arrays coordinate pairs. Optionally preserves column classes metadata block.

title: Export tibble to JSON with smart matrix handling — to_json
code: to_json(x, path = NULL, pretty = TRUE, preserve_classes = TRUE, ...)

title: Export tibble to JSON with smart matrix handling — to_json
text: x tibble, typically Momocs2 path Optional path write JSON file. NULL, returns JSON string pretty Logical, pretty-print JSON? Default TRUE preserve_classes Logical, preserve column classes metadata? Default TRUE ... Additional arguments passed jsonlite::toJSON

title: Export tibble to JSON with smart matrix handling — to_json
text: path: invisible(x). Otherwise: JSON string

title: Export tibble to JSON with smart matrix handling — to_json
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Return JSON string json_str <- to_json(bot)  # Write to file with metadata to_json(bot, "bot.json")  # Write without metadata (smaller files) to_json(bot, "bot_bare.json", preserve_classes = FALSE) } # }

what: Extract multiple boundaries from binary mask — trace_boundary_multi
title: Extract multiple boundaries from binary mask — trace_boundary_multi
text: Low-level function extracts raw boundary coordinates objects mask using contourLines(). Returns list coordinate matrices without additional processing (reordering, direction checking).

title: Extract multiple boundaries from binary mask — trace_boundary_multi
code: trace_boundary_multi(mask)

title: Extract multiple boundaries from binary mask — trace_boundary_multi
text: mask Logical matrix. TRUE = object, FALSE = background

title: Extract multiple boundaries from binary mask — trace_boundary_multi
text: List matrices, (n × 2) raw x,y coordinates

title: Extract multiple boundaries from binary mask — trace_boundary_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ mask <- img_mask(img_load("petri_dish.png")) boundaries <- trace_boundary_multi(mask) } # }

what: Extract outline from binary mask — trace_outline
title: Extract outline from binary mask — trace_outline
text: Traces boundary object binary mask using Moore-Neighbor chain code algorithm. Outline starts rightmost point traces counter-clockwise (positive/mathematical direction).

title: Extract outline from binary mask — trace_outline
code: trace_outline(mask)

title: Extract outline from binary mask — trace_outline
text: mask Logical matrix. TRUE = object, FALSE = background

title: Extract outline from binary mask — trace_outline
text: Matrix (n × 2) x,y coordinates. Class c("", "coo", "matrix", "array")

title: Extract outline from binary mask — trace_outline
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # From mask matrix mask <- img_mask("leaf.png") outline <- trace_outline(mask) } # }

what: Extract multiple outlines from binary mask — trace_outline_multi
title: Extract multiple outlines from binary mask — trace_outline_multi
text: Traces boundaries objects binary mask using base R's contourLines(). connected object gets outline.

title: Extract multiple outlines from binary mask — trace_outline_multi
code: trace_outline_multi(mask, min_size = 10)

title: Extract multiple outlines from binary mask — trace_outline_multi
text: mask Logical matrix. TRUE = object, FALSE = background min_size Integer. Minimum number points outline. Default 10

title: Extract multiple outlines from binary mask — trace_outline_multi
text: List outline matrices, (n × 2) class c("", "coo", "matrix", "array")

title: Extract multiple outlines from binary mask — trace_outline_multi
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # From mask matrix img <- img_load("petri_dish.png") mask <- img_mask(img) outlines <- trace_outline_multi(mask) } # }

title: Momit 0.1.0
text: Initial CRAN submission.
